description:
Python has often been criticised for slow runtime performance, and for
the GIL which prevents multi-core concurrency. Cython provides tools for
addressing both issues, and in a way that is simple enough for the
average programmer to use.

This talk will show:

-  How to get started with Cython
-  Tools to make day-to-day Cython work easier
-  How to dramatically speed up a slow function
-  How to distribute work over multiple CPU cores
title: Easy wins with Cython: fast and multi-core
